messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: bibliography
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, I have it.  But Mr. Burawoy s bibiliography is only on kodogu.  I m looking for the same kind of thing for swords. David Zincavage ... From: Dr John P
messages.messageBody:
Yes, I have it. But Mr. Burawoy's bibiliography is only on kodogu. I'm looking for the same kind of thing for swords.

David Zincavage
----- Original Message -----
From: Dr John P Lissenden
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, October 22, 2005 2:31 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: bibliography


Dear David

One of the best bibliographies on Japanese language titles is to be
found in the Haynes and Burawoy '100 Selected Tsuba from European
Public Collections'. A special, numbered edition of this book included
a 'complete bibliography of publications on the subject of sword
fittings from 1693 to (the date of publication in) September 1984'.
This includes almost 400 titles, listed in the language of
publication, the degree of specialisation and the type of publication.

Sadly it contains no publications after 1984, of course.

Regards, John L.

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "David Zincavage" <jdz@u...>
wrote:
>
> There is a small bibliography of Japanese language titles in the
Kanzan Sato
> book. Does anyone know where the most complete bibliography of
Japanese
> language Nihonto titles may be found?
>
> DZ
>

messages.subject: bibliography
messages.msgSnippet: There is a small bibliography of Japanese language titles in the Kanzan Sato book.  Does anyone know where the most complete bibliography of Japanese language
messages.messageBody:
There is a small bibliography of Japanese language titles in the Kanzan Sato
book. Does anyone know where the most complete bibliography of Japanese
language Nihonto titles may be found?

DZ
